bibl.title: Ben cao gang mu dictionary Vol1

sense.def: Illness Sign of a sensation of a bitter taste on the surface of the tongue despite the fact that one has not ingested any beverage or food. Pu ji fang 普濟方 153: 熱病後脾胃氣虛，四肢 乏力，骨節煩疼，口乾舌苦，不思飲食 , “In the aftermath of a heat disease, spleen and stomach qi is depleted. The four limbs lack strength, the bone joints are distressed with pain. The mouth is dry and the tongue has a bitter taste . One does not wish to eat or drink”. Ben cao gang mu 本草綱目 Bai bing zhu zhi yao 百病主治藥： 舌苦是膽熱，甘是脾熱，酸是濕熱，澀是風熱，辛是燥熱，咸是脾濕， 淡是胃虛 , “A bitter taste of the tongue results from gallbladder heat; a sweet taste [of the tongue] results from spleen heat; a sour taste results from moisture heat; a roughness results from wind heat; an acrid taste results from dryness heat; a salty taste results from spleen moisture; a tasteless [tongue] results from stomach depletion”.
